Package com.sm3.connect4.model

Class ModelEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • java.awt.AWTEvent
        • java.awt.event.ActionEvent
          • com.sm3.connect4.model.ModelEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class ModelEvent
extends ActionEvent
    A class that is used to notify the view(ModelListener) when a disc has been placed in the grid in the Game, or to send a message to the view.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ModelEvent​(Object obj, int id, String command, int column, int row, char color, String message, boolean win)
      Creates a ModelEvent with information about the placed disc in the Game model.
      ModelEvent​(Object obj, int id, String command, String message)
      Creates a ModelEvent if a disc was not placed and/or a message needs to be sent to the view.

        Creates a ModelEvent if a disc was not placed and/or a message needs to be sent to the view.

      • ModelEvent

        public ModelEvent​(Object obj,
                  int id,
                  String command,
                  int column,
                  int row,
                  char color,
                  String message,
                  boolean win)
        Creates a ModelEvent with information about the placed disc in the Game model.
        Parameters:
        obj - An Object for the superclass ActionEvent
        id - An integer for the superclass ActionEvent
        command - A String for the superclass ActionEvent
        column - A integer to represent the column of the disc
        row - A integer to represent the row of the disc
        color - A char to represent the color of the disc
        message - A String for the message to the view.
        win - A boolean to represent if the game has been won.

        public boolean getContent()
        Gets the content boolean.
        Returns:
        A boolean to represent if the class object has initialized the column, row, color, and win params.
